Yeah i do have some lvs, but i have to finish them,   Well It is supposed to
be one giant scenario with a series of stages 46-100  If ya want, any lv
makers other then myself out there want to look at them and help me finish
the rest of them, i think i have 46-90 done, but may need help with the
other 10.  hehehe and my last name is spelled with one R not 2 hehehe just
to clarify


This Has Been Another Message sent
by Ricky Der, The Legendary
Cleric and Wizard of Light
----- Original Message -----
From: Tom Tildrum <Tevildo@...>
To: <gladiator@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, December 06, 2000 8:21 AM
Subject: [gladiator] Crossovers


> For several years I've had a disk laying around with a bunch of .PUD files
> on it, but I didn't know exactly what those were so I left them alone. I
> recently obtained a copy of the Warcraft II Battlechest (full basic
version
> w/online matchup and expansion levels) and found that .PUDs are
> player-designed Warcraft levels, and those ones on the disk were all based
> on The Hobbit and The Lord Of The Rings by J.R.R. Tolkien. Naturally, I
> tried them out, and some of them kicked ass and some of them sucked. They
> got me thinking: the three games I'm involved in now are Warcraft,
> Gladiator, and The Two Towers (a Tolkien-based Multi-User Dimension,
> http://angband.com/towers), and crossovers between the three would truly
> rock. Why not have Warcraft levels based on the stock Gladiator scenarios,
> or vice versa, or Tolkien-based scenarios with corresponding levels? I
threw
> some Greek mythology into the TevFifty, but I'm thinking here of complete
> immersion in the story. Gladiator has several advantages in this
department:
> you can include the story blurb, which can be very cool; you can name
> characters; you can see who the enemy is and go kill him, rather than
having
> to sit there whacking farms and such. With Warcraft, you have better
> graphics and the ability to wage war at sea and in the sky, but you can
only
> use the preprogrammed character names, and if you want a storyline you
have
> to put it in a separate text file. The magic and the maps are about equal.
> Anyone have any ideas in this vein? Over the semester break I should have
> enough time to actually execute some of this stuff in the Tevildo style,
and
> also do that fanfic stuff I was talking about earlier with attached
> scenarios. I hope there are other people out there doing their own thing,
> and it's not just DPH and I creating. Ricky Derr, got any levels for us?
> Shayd? Anyone? Oh, man... how cool would it be to just insert the code for
> dragons and death knights into Gladiator... (salivating) That's all for
now.
> Good luck and regards,
>    -Tevildo.
>    http://hotyellow98.com/tevildo/glad.html
>
> Oh, did anyone get any use out of the altered rock graphics file I posted
to
> the Egroups site? That was just an experiment... I could alter basically
any
> weapon or character .PIX. Just say the word.
>
